qas.question: When did Vazgen acquire his position?
Where is the memorial for the Armenian Genocide?
When was the Armenian Genocide Memorial constructed?

context: Fears decreased when Stalin died in <a1_0>1953<a1_0/> and <a0_0>Nikita Khruschev<a0_0/> emerged as the Soviet Union's new leader. Soon, life in Soviet Armenia began to see rapid improvement. The church, which suffered greatly under Stalin, was revived when Catholicos Vazgen I assumed the duties of his office in <a2_0>1955<a2_0/>. In <a4_0>1967<a4_0/>, a memorial to the victims of the Armenian Genocide was built at the Tsitsernakaberd hill above the Hrazdan gorge in <a3_0>Yerevan<a3_0/>. This occurred after mass demonstrations took place on the tragic event's fiftieth anniversary in 1965.
